wikipedia_page.main:
Andrew Richard Bray (born 29 October 1981 in Westminster, London) is an English cricketer. Bray is a right-handed batsman who bowls right-arm fast-medium.
Bray represented the Kent Cricket Board in List A cricket. His debut List A match came against the Worcestershire Cricket Board in the 2000 NatWest Trophy. From 2000 to 2001, he represented the Board in 5 List A matches, the last of which came against the Leicestershire Cricket Board in the 2nd of the 2002 Cheltenham & Gloucester Trophy which was held in 2001. In his 5 List A matches, he scored 5 runs at a batting average of 2.50, with a high score of 5. With the ball he took 4 wickets at a bowling average of 37.50, with best figures of 2/18.He currently plays club cricket for Folkestone Cricket Club in the Kent Cricket League.
